add-insight-to-dashboard.description: Add an existing insight to a dashboard. Requires insight ID and dashboard ID. Optionally supports layout and color customization.
add-insight-to-dashboard.summary: Add an existing insight to a dashboard.
add-insight-to-dashboard.title: Add insight to dashboard

dashboard-create.description: Create a new dashboard in the project. Requires name and optional description, tags, and other properties.
dashboard-create.summary: Create a new dashboard in the project.
dashboard-create.title: Create dashboard

dashboard-delete.description: Delete a dashboard by ID (soft delete - marks as deleted).
dashboard-delete.title: Delete dashboard

dashboard-get.description: Get a specific dashboard by ID. The response will include insights / tiles that are on the dashboard.
dashboard-get.summary: Get a specific dashboard by ID, including insights that are on the dashboard.
dashboard-get.title: Get dashboard

dashboards-get-all.description: Get all dashboards in the project with optional filtering. Can filter by pinned status, search term, or pagination.
dashboards-get-all.summary: Get all dashboards in the project with optional filtering.
dashboards-get-all.title: Get all dashboards

dashboard-update.description: Update an existing dashboard by ID. Can update name, description, pinned status or tags.
dashboard-update.summary: Update an existing dashboard by ID.
dashboard-update.title: Update dashboard

docs-search.description: Use this tool to search the PostHog documentation for information that can help the user with their request. Use it as a fallback when you cannot answer the user's request using other tools in this MCP. Only use this tool for PostHog related questions.
docs-search.summary: Search the PostHog documentation for information.
docs-search.title: Search docs

error-details.description: Use this tool to get the details of an error in the project.
error-details.summary: Get the details of an error in the project.
error-details.title: Get error details

list-errors.description: Use this tool to list errors in the project.
list-errors.title: List errors

create-feature-flag.description: Creates a new feature flag in the project. Once you have created a feature flag, you should: Ask the user if they want to add it to their codebase, Use the "search-docs" tool to find documentation on how to add feature flags to the codebase (search for the right language / framework), Clarify where it should be added and then add it.
create-feature-flag.summary: Creates a new feature flag in the project.
create-feature-flag.title: Create feature flag

delete-feature-flag.description: Delete a feature flag in the project.
delete-feature-flag.summary: Delete a feature flag in the project.
delete-feature-flag.title: Delete feature flag

feature-flag-get-all.description: Get all feature flags in the project.
feature-flag-get-all.summary: Get all feature flags in the project.
feature-flag-get-all.title: Get all feature flags

feature-flag-get-definition.description: Get the definition of a feature flag. You can provide either the flagId or the flagKey. If you provide both, the flagId will be used.
feature-flag-get-definition.summary: Get the definition of a feature flag.
feature-flag-get-definition.title: Get feature flag definition

update-feature-flag.description: Update a new feature flag in the project. To enable a feature flag, you should make sure it is active and the rollout percentage is set to 100 for the group you want to target. To disable a feature flag, you should make sure it is inactive, you can keep the rollout percentage as it is.
update-feature-flag.summary: Update a feature flag in the project.
update-feature-flag.title: Update feature flag

experiment-get-all.description: Get all experiments in the project.
experiment-get-all.summary: Get all experiments in the project.
experiment-get-all.title: Get all experiments

experiment-get.description: Get details of a specific experiment by ID.
experiment-get.summary: Get details of a specific experiment.
experiment-get.title: Get experiment details

insight-create-from-query.description: Create an insight from a query that you have previously tested with 'query-run'. You should check the query runs, before creating an insight. Do not create an insight before running the query, unless you know already that it is correct (e.g. you are making a minor modification to an existing query you have seen).
insight-create-from-query.summary: Save a query as an insight.
insight-create-from-query.title: Create insight from query

insight-delete.description: Delete an insight by ID (soft delete - marks as deleted).
insight-delete.title: Delete insight

insight-get.description: Get a specific insight by ID.
insight-get.summary: Get a specific insight by ID.
insight-get.title: Get insight

insight-query.description: Execute a query on an existing insight to get its results/data. Provide the insight ID to retrieve the current query results.
insight-query.summary: Execute a query on an existing insight to get its results/data.
insight-query.title: Query insight

insights-get-all.description: Get all insights in the project with optional filtering. Can filter by saved status, favorited status, or search term.
insights-get-all.summary: Get all insights in the project with optional filtering.
insights-get-all.title: Get all insights

insight-update.description: Update an existing insight by ID. Can update name, description, filters, and other properties. You should get the insight before update it to see it's current query structure, and only modify the parts needed to answer the user's request.
insight-update.summary: Update an existing insight by ID.
insight-update.title: Update insight

query-run.description: You should use this to answer questions that a user has about their data and for when you want to create a new insight. You can use 'event-definitions-list' to get events to use in the query, and 'event-properties-list' to get properties for those events. It can run a trend, funnel or HogQL query. Where possible, use a trend or funnel rather than a HogQL query, unless you know the HogQL is correct (e.g. it came from a previous insight.).
query-run.summary: Run a trend, funnel or HogQL query.
query-run.title: Run query

query-generate-hogql-from-question.description: This is a slow tool, and you should only use it once you have tried to create a query using the 'query-run' tool, or the query is too complicated to create a trend / funnel. Queries project's PostHog data based on a provided natural language question - don't provide SQL query as input but describe the output you want. When giving the results back to the user, first show the SQL query that was used, then provide results in reasily readable format. You should also offer to save the query as an insight if the user wants to.
query-generate-hogql-from-question.summary: Queries project's PostHog data based on a provided natural language question.
query-generate-hogql-from-question.title: Generate SQL

get-llm-total-costs-for-project.description: Fetches the total LLM daily costs for each model for a project over a given number of days. If no number of days is provided, it defaults to 7. The results are sorted by model name. The total cost is rounded to 4 decimal places. The query is executed against the project's data warehouse. Show the results as a Markdown formatted table with the following information for each model: Model name, Total cost in USD, Each day's date, Each day's cost in USD. Write in bold the model name with the highest total cost. Properly render the markdown table in the response.
get-llm-total-costs-for-project.summary: Fetches the total LLM daily costs for each model for a project over a given number of days.
get-llm-total-costs-for-project.title: Get LLM costs

organization-details-get.description: Get the details of the active organization.
organization-details-get.summary: Get the details of the active organization.
organization-details-get.title: Get organization details

organizations-get.description: Get the organizations the user has access to.
organizations-get.summary: Get the organizations the user has access to.
organizations-get.title: Get organizations

switch-organization.description: Change the active organization from the default organization. You should only use this tool if the user asks you to change the organization - otherwise, the default organization will be used.
switch-organization.summary: Change the active organization from the default organization.
switch-organization.title: Switch active organization

projects-get.description: Fetches projects that the user has access to in the current organization.
projects-get.summary: Fetches projects that the user has access to in the current organization.
projects-get.title: Get projects

event-definitions-list.description: List all event definitions in the project with optional filtering. Can filter by search term.
event-definitions-list.summary: List all event definitions in the project with optional filtering.
event-definitions-list.title: List all events

properties-list.description: List properties for events or persons. If fetching event properties, you must provide an event name.
properties-list.summary: Get properties for events or persons.
properties-list.title: Get properties

property-definitions.description: Get event and property definitions for the project.
property-definitions.summary: Get event and property definitions for the project.
property-definitions.title: Get property definitions

switch-project.description: Change the active project from the default project. You should only use this tool if the user asks you to change the project - otherwise, the default project will be used.
switch-project.summary: Change the active project from the default project.
switch-project.title: Switch active project
